intro: Cardamine flaccida f. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate watercress, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to moist woodland areas. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and prefers shady, damp environments. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsules that contain numerous small seeds. This fern-like plant is often found in the understory of forests and along stream banks.
